name: satureja vulgaris
description: Similar in appearance to Blephilia hirsuta. *This species may be difficult and/or slow to germinate and grow to maturity.  Satureja vulgaris (Wild Basil) is an aromatic mint, growing to 24" tall. Though common to moist woodlands of the Northeast, S. vulgaris tolerates a wide rage of moisture and sunlight exposure. Flowering in middle to late summer, the pink flowers are irregularly tube-shaped, forming dense whorls.
